snippet: There’s nothing new about false modesty. But social media sites like Twitter have given us many more canvases on which to paint our faux humility — making us increasingly sophisticated braggers.
abstract: Henry Alford essay observes that false modesty and self-deprecating boasts, also known as 'the humblebrag,' have been around forever, but social media sites like Twitter have given people the forum to become increasingly sophisticated braggers online.
lead_paragraph: There’s nothing new about false modesty. But social media sites like Twitter have given us many more canvases on which to paint our faux humility — making us increasingly sophisticated braggers.

headline.print_headline: If I Do Humblebrag So Myself
headline.seo: Bah, Humblebrag: The (Unfortunate) Rise of False Humility
headline.main: If I Do Humblebrag So Myself
